oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Counterexamples for IFS-attractors
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Nowak, Magdalena
Fernandez-Martinez, Manuel
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Dynamical Systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: In this paper, we deal with the part of Fractal Theory related to finite families of (weak) contractions, called iterated function systems (IFS, herein). An attractor is a compact set which remains invariant for such a family. Thus, we consider spaces homeomorphic to attractors of either IFS or weak IFS, as well, which we will refer to as Banach and topological fractals, respectively. We present a collection of counterexamples in order to show that all the presented definitions are essential, though they are not equivalent in general.
